channel.title: Buying a new cell phone
channel.description: im going to be buying a new cellphone either this Friday or next was just wondering what kind I should get, i dont mind spending a pretty penny & figured most of u have cell phones so u would know about most of this stuff.

item.title: Buying a new cell phone
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Moparisthebest:

All networks in the USA have at least a few Android phones, and Android is awesome, so I’d recommend you get any phone that runs android. I have a Motorola Droid, the Motorola Droid 2 looks pretty awesome though.

^x100

Read full topic

item.title: Buying a new cell phone
item.dc:creator: @Z_0_D_I_A_C Z 0 D I A C
item.description:
@Z_0_D_I_A_C wrote:

[quote=“John459, post:27, topic:369948”][quote author=Z 0 D I A C link=topic=466067.msg3408594#msg3408594 date=1290500850]

which is better the droid or the iphone?

Android has great performance, and there’s a variety of phones to choose from. Including the Android Market for apps.

Apple iPhones have a ton of apps and you can jailbreak it for customization. The apple store has thousands of applications and the Cydia store has thousands of themes to choose from. the iphones performance is pretty great too.

But you can’t get the Motorola Droid since you’re on AT&T. but you can buy the Motorola Milestone which is the Droid but it uses Sim cards instead of Verizons EVDO network.
[/quote]

Have you ever heard of rooting a droid?

Also, there are plenty of android devices on at&t so an iphone should never be an option.[/quote]

I’m sure he wouldn’t wanna go through all the trouble.

Read full topic

item.title: Buying a new cell phone
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

[quote=“Z 0 D I A C, post:24, topic:369948”][quote author=Mr. Bobby link=topic=466067.msg3408587#msg3408587 date=1290500409]
which is better the droid or the iphone?
[/quote]

Android has great performance, and there’s a variety of phones to choose from. Including the Android Market for apps.

Apple iPhones have a ton of apps and you can jailbreak it for customization. The apple store has thousands of applications and the Cydia store has thousands of themes to choose from. the iphones performance is pretty great too.

But you can’t get the Motorola Droid since you’re on AT&T. but you can buy the Motorola Milestone which is the Droid but it uses Sim cards instead of Verizons EVDO network.[/quote]

Have you ever heard of rooting a droid?

Also, there are plenty of android devices on at&t so an iphone should never be an option.

Read full topic

item.title: Buying a new cell phone
item.dc:creator: @Z_0_D_I_A_C Z 0 D I A C
item.description:
@Z_0_D_I_A_C wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]I’m currently selling all my iPhones in hopes to get T-Mobile’s MyTouch Slide with 4G network, or I may get one of T-Mobile’s newer droids.

[quote author=Mr. Bobby link=topic=466067.msg3408587#msg3408587 date=1290500409]
which is better the droid or the iphone?
[/quote]Droid, no competition.[/quote]

You can also get the Samsung Captivate or Galaxy S which runs Android Froyo.

Read full topic

item.title: Buying a new cell phone
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Since you probably don’t need any of the business security features of Blackberry, stay away from it. I’d go with Android since it seems like the phones I see running it keep getting better and better hardware.

Read full topic

item.title: Buying a new cell phone
item.dc:creator: @Z_0_D_I_A_C Z 0 D I A C
item.description:
@Z_0_D_I_A_C wrote:

Mr. Bobby:

which is better the droid or the iphone?

Android has great performance, and there’s a variety of phones to choose from. Including the Android Market for apps.

Apple iPhones have a ton of apps and you can jailbreak it for customization. The apple store has thousands of applications and the Cydia store has thousands of themes to choose from. the iphones performance is pretty great too.

But you can’t get the Motorola Droid since you’re on AT&T. but you can buy the Motorola Milestone which is the Droid but it uses Sim cards instead of Verizons EVDO network.

Read full topic

@Z_0_D_I_A_C wrote:

Moparisthebest:

All networks in the USA have at least a few Android phones, and Android is awesome, so I’d recommend you get any phone that runs android. I have a Motorola Droid, the Motorola Droid 2 looks pretty awesome though.

If I was on the Verizon network in the US, I would totally get the Motorola Droid X or 2, It’s confirmed that Verizon’s getting the iPhone 5.

item.title: Buying a new cell phone
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

Just wait for this in 2011: http://androidcommunity.com/lg-targeting-high-end-phone-market-lg-star-coming-in-2011-20101117/

The LG Star will be an extremely powerful device. It will feature a NVIDIA Tegrea 2 processor which will provide 1 GHz dual-core processing speeds. Along with this chip, the LG Star is expected to be running a near stock version of Android 2.3 Gingerbread.

The device will feature a 4-inch screen, front-facing camera, 8-megapixel rear camera, LED flash, and a 1500 mAh battery. With the impressive camera on back, the device will be able to record videos in 1080p which is a step up from current phones, like the iPhone 4, Droid X, and Galaxy S, that are limited to 720p.

Read full topic

Blackberry Bold
